intro: Melampyrum nemorosum subsp. catalaunicum, commonly known as the Catalan touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in forested areas and along woodland edges in southern Europe. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its adaptation to shaded environments.
